website_summaries.verdict: The curved LG 55EC9300 proves that OLED technology is the future of HDTVs, even if it's too expensive for most consumers right now.
pros: Very good 3D effect with both included glasses and clip-on lenses
cons: Magic Remote can be tricky to use at times

customer_reviews.title: TV Completely died after warranty
customer_reviews.text: The 55EC9300 has known issues of having a faulty board and power supply. And now that mine is out of warranty I am unable to get the issue resolved. I have found several people on the online forums who have the exact same issue that I have where there is a click when the tv turns on, then 2 seconds later it clicks again and powers off.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The most gorgeous TV I've ever seen. Expensive but worth every dollar. Updated (6-7 months after receiving the TV) Review: This TV is absolutely incredible. I can honestly say I wouldn't touch anything but OLED after owning this TV. Maybe years from now I'll go with a 4k OLED but after doing a LOT of research, 4K is actually fairly pointless unless you're getting a really big one. I remember reading an article on IGN about it. I had actually bought a $2000 4K but then cancelled the order when I read about this TV. Very glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: ... are enough reviews on here going into all the great qualities and features of this TV that I do ...
customer_reviews.text: There are enough reviews on here going into all the great qualities and features of this TV that I do not need to repeat the technical speak. Subjectively: This is the best TV I have ever owned or seen. That's it. Have had it about a month, put an OPPO blu-ray player on it and am simply amazed. I could not be happier with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: this was the best looking picture that i have seen on any TV
customer_reviews.text: Bought this TV summer of 2015. Admittedly, this was the best looking picture that i have seen on any TV. It is now 2017 and the TV is dead; will not turn on. I would expect a TV that cost approximately $2,000 to last more than 2 years. Looking at the other one star reviews, I am not the only person disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: For the 3 years it worked, it was great. Died now and unfixable. 3 boards replaced by company and all fried once in tv. Too much money for tv that didn't last
customer_reviews.author: A. Noble

customer_reviews.title: The image is really quite excellent. I'm not like a huge audio/visual buff so
customer_reviews.text: The image is really quite excellent. I'm not like a huge audio/visual buff so, aside from configurating the image, I haven't played around much with the other options, so can't talk too much about that. The only thing to note is that this TV is very flat, so like all very flat TVs, the sound coming out of it is pretty mediocre. If you are buying this TV, I would greatly recommend *at least* getting a basic soundbar (like 300-400$) to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Olivier Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely the best picture quality I've ever experienced
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the best picture quality I've ever experienced. I would say this TV is better than watching a movie at the theater. Having said that, I'm not happy with the SmartTV experience. The menus are slow and sometimes the picture studders in some apps. Additionally, I don't feel like I should have to deal with ads when downloading common apps after paying (this much) for the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: You really have to see the picture in a home environment to experience how really go the picture is. The colors, saturation and overall image quality is amazing. We switched from a Samsung plasma to the OLED LG and there is no comparison. Take a look at the CNET review. Do not be swayed by the marketing hype of 4K LED. It is good but not nearly as good as OLED. This has to be the future of TV.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Broke After one year. Some kind of screen problem ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke After one year. Some kind of screen problem. sound went weird then the picture scrambled then no power. LG was less than helpful about their warranty. Square Trade took four months to honor their protection plan. I bought it and shipped from Amazon and they didn't help either.
customer_reviews.author: cameron

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding color and clarity.  Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding picture color and clarity. Speakers were better than anticipated, but added a sound bar to boost quality. Probably would've gone with the 65" model if it wasn't such a huge jump in price. But for the lower cost, I can't complain about the picture quality of this OLED TV. I have no regrets about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Freethinker

customer_reviews.title: Great, elegant TV
customer_reviews.text: I love this TV. Really great picture and elegant design. The reds can be a bit too much though. Without careful setting (and even with careful setting), certain people are wearing lipstick when they are not!
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know what I was missing until I turned on my first OLED.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't that annoyed by backlight bleed on my previous TV, but now that I've seen OLED it would be really hard to go back to a non-OLED screen. I bought this having never seen the screen in person, based upon the positive reviews, and the image really is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mead

customer_reviews.title: A nice surprise is the "floating mouse cursor" remote works extremely ...
customer_reviews.text: The most incredible black levels and colors I've ever seen on a TV. A nice surprise is the "floating mouse cursor" remote works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Calla

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful But....
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful picture. Good looking TV. If you are someone who notices judder then get ready to experience it. I put this TV side by side with my 55" samsung 6300 playing the same movie at the same time. Noticeable Judder on the LG. I called LG did everything they said to get the best picture possible with the least judder. It wasn't good enough for me. If the tv didn't do this I would of given it 5 stars and not have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Miken

customer_reviews.title: 2 years and still happy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tv for 2 years and I still love it. It works just as well as when I first got it, and it looks amazing. The quality helps to make everything look great. I love everything about it and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: AnaYaa bediako

customer_reviews.title: excellent color representation
customer_reviews.text: Having owned a plasma I could never deal with the mediocre and washed out looking black levels on an LCD. Once OLED became affordable I had to jump at the chance. The picture quality is incredible. Deep TRUE blacks, excellent color representation, infinite contrast.. there's just no comparison. This TV has exceeded my expectations in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S

customer_reviews.title: The best TV I've ever seen: but after 1 year, it does not turn on anymore...
customer_reviews.text: The best TV I've ever seen. Amazing, fantastic, perfect. Wonderful to watch dark movies or movies with large contrast: black really means "no light" in this TV. Update: just after the warranty is over, the TV won't turn on anymore, a problem reported by other consumers.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent picture
customer_reviews.text: We were amazed at the quality of the picture. Even the old tv shows are so clear and distinct
customer_reviews.author: jant

customer_reviews.title: Burnt?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in August of 2015. Would leave TV on during day to listen to a music channel. The music channel showed the genre "SOUNDSCAPES" in big letters on a banner the complete width of the TV screen. This banner now ALWAYS shows, VERY faint, on screen regardless of HDMI port I choose, e.g. TV, a game, or blue ray.
customer_reviews.author: Walter A. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: It's one of the best I have ever seen...
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing. Wonderful picture quality. Responsive and likable interface. Gorgeous ergonomics and exterior. Perfectly saturated and uniform colors, edge-to-edge. I don't think there is another technology like it right now due to the lack of backlighting and the subsequent unparalleled uniformity compared to plasma or LED/LCD. And you can even watch TV on it!
customer_reviews.author: Gene K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, amazing, amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful TV, I was persuaded by the most popular reviews and we haven't disappointed after a year. Liked it so much, we ordered a second one (however, we had to get an Amazon refurb in order to get the 2015 model -- the reviews on the 2016 model are very mixed, or at least not nearly as strong as these reviews, which was disappointing to find). Recommended this as well to a friend, who purchased it and has also loved it (for about 9 months so far). Truly an amazing picture. ***MOUNTING*** Not sure how to mount this thing -- finally posting a picture to see if anyone has any tips.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny, an Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best picture ever on a TV. Word of caution...Replaced a nearly new Visio 70 inch led that died after a year. It died a line at a time, not a dot at a time. The term "LED TV" is misleading, in my opinion, but that's not uncommon in their world. BUT I recommend some sort of protection for your purchase. I've never done that before and it bites. My family had the same TV in the living room for all the time I lived at home. Welcome to 2015. One other thing.... The delivery people are lazy, arrogant, argumentative, and just plain useless for anything but setting the cardboard box in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: DLWiggers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: if picture quality is your main concern, do not hesitate to buy this TV.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: My friends and I were amazed by how much brighter and clearer the 3D picture ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of 3D movies, so I wanted to get another 3D tv when my old one broke. My friends and I were amazed by how much brighter and clearer the 3D picture appears compared to my old LG 55LM6700. The difference is amazing. This TV looks great ouf of the box. The design is unique and the operating system is easy to navigate. The picture is as good or better than any 4K I've seen. My only wish is that the 65 inch version was more affordable, so we settled for the 55 inch. I'm looking forward to prices on OLED TVs to drop--this is the future of high def television viewing.
customer_reviews.author: genmaicha

customer_reviews.title: Picture, design; good. Software; bad
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture, sound, and design. The software is spectacularly bad, particularly Amazon Video. Will probably have to purchase a third party streaming device.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan N

customer_reviews.title: Pixel burn-in - see photo
customer_reviews.text: See photo -- look at the pixel burn-in which showed up after approx. a year of use!! Shows bad on solid background colors, as you can see. For the 2015 price, I expected more longevity!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Rock

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super picture, almost 3D without 3D turned on. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson H.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Quality Problems and Rock Bottom LG Service.
customer_reviews.text: Picture on this TV is almost perfect. However, the first TV died within two weeks of delivery. Amazon replaced this unit. The second unit died after 4 months of operation. The current status is that for the last three and one half weeks we have been trying to get LG to repair the unit. Each time we have called, we have been instructed to wait an additional 3-5 business days. So not sure after three and a half weeks of trying what will happen or if LG's plan is that I will just eat this $3K junk TV if they make the service path difficult enough. Anyway, will update the review when I know more.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: I expect more .....
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty sure that it has the best overall picture quality available on market today. Otherwise, I own a plasma Panasonic ZT-60 TV also. I expect better performance from OLED technology but both TV side by side comparison is a tie on my point of view displaying Dish HD and several BD by OPPO BDP-95. But plasma is history now ......
customer_reviews.author: Marcio R. Legrady

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets - Better than other 4K sets out there
customer_reviews.text: Best TV I've ever seen. Even my girlfriend enjoys watching Football on this screen. While I'm sure I'll get tired of the 3D aspect at some time, it's still a fun thing to have. And yes, watching sports in 2D to 3D conversion is a real thing and I do it. I don't see any of the dimples other reviews noted. Must be luck of the draw or a manufacturing defect they've since corrected.
customer_reviews.author: J. leVine

customer_reviews.title: and I don't see how 4k could be any better even in OLED
customer_reviews.text: I just received mine yesterday, and I am totally blown away. I have never seen so many different shades of color on any of my other Televisions. It is simply stunning, and I don't see how 4k could be any better even in OLED. It looks like 3d even without 3d being applied. It would be nice if LG would make a 65 inch model in 1080P. I am confident it would be fantastic. If you can at all afford one of these, I highly recommend it. You too will be blown away. I guarantee it. Dave
customer_reviews.author: Elitefroggy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer's remorse due to quality issues
customer_reviews.text: When this TV is working, it looks great and the WebOS is a pleasure. However, it has failed to power on twice already, resulting in a service call after three months to replace the board and panel, and then the TV failed again three months later after six months of ownership. For a TV at this price, the level of quality is completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Raitz

customer_reviews.title: Oled LG is great.
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality. The black level is the best ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best hands down. I had a top of the line Samsung plasma decided to upgrade to a 4K tv. I ended up returning the 4K movies looked animated and I could see too many details for example hair lines and make up of tv anchors. This OLED tv is expensive but the picture is out of this world. Very pleasing to the eye, black levels are truly black as if the tv were turned off. The picture in my opinion can't be beat by any tv currently for sale. If you are debating between this tv and a 4K I would say go see both of them in a store you will see there is no comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Great TV. Only complaint
customer_reviews.text: Great TV. Only complaint, does not have a head phone connection.
customer_reviews.author: Ed K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent still picture
customer_reviews.text: Excellent still picture, great looking TV, but among the worst I've seen with motion handling. Judder is terrible on this TV - even with basic on screen movements.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Wont power-up after three months!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this TV for just over two months! and it wont power up 90% of the time! Save your money! Update 5/20/15 LG is going to refund, but I have to box the 55 inch and use prepaid FedEx shipping. Boxing this is going to be a Pain! LG is standing up and refunding. maybe in two months or so I will have an TV that works. It is 5/29/15 FedEx picked the dead TV yesterday, I'll keep-up dating this post has to when I get a check.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand how others are satisfied.!
customer_reviews.text: The Picture is Very Dark it doesn't seem to be progressed in the future, even I tried to make it brighter to adjust according to the instruction Manual . I don't understand how others are satisfied. !!!
customer_reviews.author: A Movie Collector

customer_reviews.title: "BREAKING" NEWS: LG OLED TV Succombs After Minor Impact
customer_reviews.text: A moderate impact on the screen rendered this device inoperative within 24 hours of installation. (...My fault, I am not blaming LG.) Since the TV was now worthless, I decided to test the screen to see how fragile it was. The result: A quick but light strike using the handle of a screw driver was enough to crack the screen. In my opinion, if there is any possibility of the screen being struck by any sort of object over the life of the TV I would be hesitant to buy this model. Note: I have 2 LG LED/LCD displays and have not had problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: B Aware

customer_reviews.title: Fo to burnin issues, I changed my bid.
customer_reviews.text: fo to burnin I revised my bid. I have now seen burnin on every oled model to date and therefore highly recommend people avoid oleds. The Samsung JS9500 is a 4K HDR display, HDR absolutely will make any current oled look bad with no burnin issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget lover

product_meta.title: LG Electronics 55EC9300 55-Inch 1080p Curved Smart OLED TV (2015 Model)
product_meta.description: Style:Everyday OfferThe LG EC9300 CURVED OLED TV is a marvel of design and performance. The gracefully curved Full HD 1080p screen offers "Perfect Black" for infinite contrast, while LG's 4 Color Pixel technology enables a broader range of more accurate colors. Featuring the award-winning LG Smart TV with webOS*, the EC9300 makes it easy to enjoy movies and more from a host of premium content providers like Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, YouTube and Hulu Plus. Disclaimer: *Internet subscription required, not included. Fees may apply.
feature_bullets: Backlight: OLED does not require a backlight giving it deep blacks and making it extremely thin
Dimensions (W x H x D): TV without stand: 48.2'' x 28.1" x 3.1'', TV with stand: 48.2'' x 29.6'' x 8.0''
Inputs: 4 HDMI, 3 USB, 1 Component, 1 Composite, 1 Digital Audio Out, 1 LAN

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars128 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
